means: 锯盖鱼，拇指顶鼻尖（一种污辱性动作）
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 斯努克地貌名称，一块突出的地，来源于中世纪英语

sentence.Network_en: Tories cocked a snook at their prime minister over this legislation.
sentence.Network_cn: 保守党人就这一法规向他们的首相表示了轻蔑。

sentence.Network_en: The boy cocked a snook at the policeman's back after being scolded.
sentence.Network_cn: 男孩在被训斥之后在警察背后作轻蔑的手势.

sentence.Network_en: As a painter, she cocks a snook at traditional techniques.
sentence.Network_cn: 作为一名画家, 她瞧不起传统画法.

lj.lj_ly: “&I{[The clock]}  is set wrong and hung crooked, as if to cock a snook at the importance of time” (&b{Kevin Crossley-Holland})
lj.lj_ls: “&I{[时钟]} 走错了并且吊歪了，就好象对时间的重要性不屑一顾” (&b{凯文·克罗斯勒—荷兰})

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from Dutch snoek (see snoek)

entry.tran: 对(权威或机构)进行侮辱(或表示轻蔑)
entry.def: If you cock a snook at someone in authority or at an organization, you do something that they cannot punish you for, but which insults them or expresses your contempt.

example.ex: Tories cocked a snook at their prime minister over this legislation.
example.tran: 保守党人就这一法规向他们的首相表示了轻蔑。

means.word_mean: 1. large tropical American food and game fishes of coastal and brackish waters; resemble pike

auth_sentence.content: More important to the regime is to cock a snook at its several enemies.
